Energy at the core

At microscopic scales, matter behaves in ways that make energy an important descriptor. Living systems show bioelectric activity and chemical energy flows that underlie physiology. Therapeutic frameworks use the "energy" concept to organize somatic awareness and practice.

Observer effect & intention

Expectations and focused attention alter subjective experience and can modulate nervous system responses. Studies of placebo and meditation show measurable changes in brain and autonomic function correlated with intention and attention.

Nonlocality (entanglement)

Entanglement is a robust quantum effect but has strict physical constraints and cannot be used for faster-than-light communication in the way popular accounts sometimes suggest. Use the entanglement metaphor carefully when discussing remote healing; place emphasis on relational, psychological, and ritual factors that are well-supported.
